Back during the days when the school first began, the First Principal, Jessica Jenkins, has saw the inevitable rivalry and in school bullying that would happen in a large campus and made strives to prevent it. She instituted anti bullying regimes but they, like now, failed miserably. She attempted to instill discipline herself. That too failed. Finally, seeing the downtrodden nerds and other rejects, she sponsored a club that would grow to be an organization. They were known as Enforcers. They would have a hard time fighting the bullying and soon Jessica has quit to pursue a law career instead.

Enforcers are the girls in the school who have decided to form a “School Watch” in order to cut down in bullying and to keep the halls clean, fair, and bully free. They aren’t always successful. They have fallen from grace but lately have been growing back into renown again after their founder had returned after a lack of jobs, something that infuriates Jessica and has taken a new goal in eradicating bullying.

They have better classes, lunches, and get better treatment from the teachers. This infuriates the other students and the enforcers naturally get a lot of hate and have to fight back. They are after all, a neighborhood watch of sorts but schoolwide. They are to keep the nerds safe and to help fight back against the bullies.

Their main recruits would of course be the nerds and the rejects, the downtrodden few being stepped on by thir betters.

On paper it is idealistic and appealing. The truth is that it can be just as bad as everyone else. Some enforcers are corrupt and use their newfound position to bully others subtlety. Others just straight up bully people under the guise of investigating troublemakers.

Enforcers are typically students that are given a class period free for patrolling and make up their work in a different time.

Uniform & Ranks

Recruits - Any nerd that grows tired of her position, may find better opportunity. She does not and will often find herself here. They are the lowest and are the most likely to get mistreated from fellow enforcers. They have a uniform consisting of a simple white blouse and dark green and black skirt with leggings underneath. They have a black and green cardigan on top and typically they wear “school issued” granny panties underneath, much to the chagrin of the recruits.

Being greenhorn recruits, and typically meaning just barely trained nerds, means that Recruits have to be organized into groups of 9 and an Officer to be truly effective, especially against the Bulls and Wolves.

They are to patrol hallways, control checkpoints in order to keep troublemakers subdued, and help any victims along the way in zones dubbed as “Green”.

Enforcers- They are the backbone of the Enforcer Corp, and are typically girls that have done a decent amount of time as Recruits and are eligible for bigger duties. They still wear the same uniform as the Recruits but can add personal touches like graffiti or pins to their uniform. They are organized into groups of 4 with an Officer to lead them. They however are still limited to granny panties.

Their main jobs are like the recruits, but are sent into “Yellow Zones” and have an added duty of activitely going after troublemakers themselves and investigating disturbances.

Sufficiently veteran or extraordinary Enforcers are sent to “Red Zones”, always patrolling, always fighting for control, and rarely winning. They are in the zones to fight for the control of the school again, and to protect nerds everywhere.

This is where corruption is often the highest though...

Officers - Their uniforms are the same the Enforcers but have an added yellow sash and ornament pins that denote them as higher, and can control underlings. They have to be fast, smart, strong, ruthless, or cunning to be promoted and often they are hardened nerds that have become something better. They are still however limited to granny panties, as befitting of nerds, even former ones.

Captain- They are the best of all of them. There are few however but they can probably take down a group of jocks, bulls, and maybe a few wolves if lucky. They are often clever yet, arrogant. They wear straight up black skirts and leggings along with the jacket and have the privilege of wearing any kind of underwear ranging from granny panties to thongs.

They control the chains of command, a hierarchy that manages sections of the school they control. The duty of the Enforcers is to create a safe and effective learning environment for the future of the girls in it, attracting nerds from all over the area to a large school of large gangs and troublemakers. They keep the halls clean and the tuition funds them. They ensure that the nerds will be protected and that their dorms won’t be broken into and harassed.

Green - Zones that have few bullies, a content student body, and are zones that nerds rush to go to. Can occasionally be attacked by lone Whisperers or Wolves but are often then not, safe. For nerds anyway. Everyone else is under the yoke of an oppressive and corrupt organization just as bad as bullies sometimes.

Yellow - Zones that are generally safe but have a tendency to have sudden intrusions of bullies. Nerds can be content but are often agitated and nervous about the bullies lurking around. Fighting is not too rare but not too common.

Red Zones - Zones that are still heavily contested by Enforcers and whatever student body trouble makers are in the area. Having to fight constantly, there are many signs of sadism and corruption but the lack of usable manpower means that it is tolerated at best. These zones are hostile for nerds and many cry out in anguish as they are bullies daily. Even teachers bemoan being stuck in these lawless areas.
